newsitem.title: POLAND: DUTCH-GERMAN FIRM STARTS POLISH SUPERMARKET CHAIN.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH-GERMAN FIRM STARTS POLISH SUPERMARKET CHAIN.

text.p: A consortium of Dutch and German retailers, Ahold NV and Allkauf, plans to invest tens of millions of dollars to develop a supermarket chain in Poland, the company's president said on Monday.
"We want to invest tens of millions of dollars in the chain," Jan de Bruyn said at the opening ceremony of the firm's first supermarket in the southern city of Krakow.

De Bruyn said the firm's second supermarket would open in November this year in the southern city of Tychy and then six more would start operating in the region between the southern cities of Wroclaw and Krakow.
The Krakow supermarket, employing 480 people, has an area of 10,000 square metres and retail area of 6,000 square metres.
Large western retailers, such as French Casino , Leclerc, Auchan or Austria's Billa have opened dozens of supermakets in the increasingly lucrative Polish market.
Small local traders demand that the government impose limits on the foreign supermarkets' expansion.
